paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses various TTR variants, particularly TTR V30M, and their implications in transthyretin amyloidosis, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Predominantly from Portugal, Japan, and Sweden

individual_records.evidence_sentence: FAP presents a wide geographic distribution, with the largest populations in Portugal, Japan, and Sweden, and is estimated to affect ∼5000–10,000 patients worldwide.
Some individuals carrying the TTR V30M variant remain unaffected.

functional_data.summary: CLR01 was shown to inhibit TTR aggregation in vitro.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in regions with high prevalence.
variants.population_frequency: Variant is common in specific populations, particularly in Portugal.
variants.additional_notes: The TTR V30M variant is the most studied in relation to FAP.
key_quotes: Substitution of methionine for valine at position 30 of TTR (TTR V30M) results from the most common mutation associated with familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP).
FAP presents a wide geographic distribution, with the largest populations in Portugal, Japan, and Sweden.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text.
